description: Encoder64 Blog - PHP-based blogging application running on Apache/2.4.54 with PHP 7.4.33
notes:
CRITICAL VULNERABILITIES IDENTIFIED:
1. Local File Inclusion (LFI) in post.php?id parameter - accepts path traversal (../index.php returns 200 OK)
2. Direct access to post files in /posts/ directory bypasses intended routing
3. POST form on contact.php accepts user input (potential XSS, SQLi, command injection)
4. Directory listing disabled but directories exist (/static/, /posts/, /static/images/)
5. .htaccess file exists (403 Forbidden)
6. No security headers observed (X-Frame-Options, CSP, HSTS missing)
7. Pagination parameter ?page= could be vulnerable to SQLi or other injection attacks
8. Base64 encoded string in header: "e0knbV9hX1NjcmlwdF9LaWRkaWV9" (potential credential/flag)
